intro: Peplis diandra, commonly known as the African orchid, is a flowering plant native to the savannas of southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing clusters of white or pale pink blossoms. Peplis diandra is adapted to arid conditions, with deep root systems that allow it to thrive in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
